pullRequest.body:
... and additive versions. These lemmas are not affine (`n` appears twice on the RHS and only once on the LHS). Also note that `mul_pow` and `mul_zpow` are analogous but not simp.

From LeanAPAP


---

- ...

- ...

nodes.body:
### PR summary [5d5ee87b27](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17019/commits/5d5ee87b275f70a02a194051496b82814d3e5701)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Is `mul_zpow` a simp lemma? If so, then I'm not sure I agree with this PR; if not, then I think that's a good justification to include in the description.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11000038386/job/30541561277)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11000038386/job/30541560644)

This breaks
```
example : (Complex.I / 3) ^ 2 = -(1 / 9) := by norm_num
```
which is annoying
Those lemmas can be added back to the `norm_num` simp set. That's what I did for `field_simp`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: Unsimp `div_pow`/`div_zpow`
